intro: Cerastium gracile var. genuinum, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe. It features small, hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers in early summer. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. It has a compact growth habit with stems that often lie close to the ground. Its foliage and flowers are covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
